text.p: Southern California Edison, an Edison International company, said two of its crewmen died on Monday after performing work on a power pole in City of Industry.
The company said the crewmen were injured in the afternoon while working at the city's North Baldwin Park Boulevard.
The employees -- Adel J. Boyadjian, 31, of LaVerne and Steven F. Peralta, Jr, 35, of Victorville -- were part of a four-person crew sent to replace a failed transformer, the company said.
Preliminary reports indicated the incident occurred at some point after the crew had replaced the transformer and re-energised the equipment, it said.
They were still on the power pole when an adjacent transformer failed, and suffered severe burns, the company said. Edison officials said the incident was still under investigation.
Boyadjian, an electrical crew foreman, had been with Edison for almost 11 years, while Peralta, a lineman and splicer, had 13 years experience with the utility, the company said.
The incident caused about 1,200 customers to temporarily lose power in the area, it added.
"Our hearts go out to the families, friends and co-workers of these two dedicated employees," said Stephen Frank, Southern California Edison president.
